description: Change of use of a single family dwellinghouse (Use Class C3) to a small HMO (Use Class C4).
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title(s): Existing 3D image EX-E001, Existing 3D image EX-E002, Existing Elevations EX-E003, Existing Side Elevation EX-E004, Existing Section EX-S001, Existing Ground Floor Plan EX-P001, Existing First Floor Plan EX-P002, Existing Roof Plan EX-P003, Existing Site Location and Block Plan EX-L001, Proposed 3D image PR-E001 rev A, Proposed 3D image PR-E002 rev A, Proposed Elevations PR-E003 rev A, Proposed Side Elevation PR-E004 rev A, Proposed Section PR-S001 rev A, Proposed Ground Floor Plan PR-P001 rev A, Proposed First Floor Plan PR-P002 rev A, Proposed Roof Plan PR-P003 rev A, Proposed Site Location and Block Plan PR-L001 rev A, HMO Management Plan.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.

| The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage within a secure enclosure has been provided in accordance with the designated location identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 and in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall permanently retained thereafter.
Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policy SI 8 of the London Plan (2021).
| The maximum number of persons occupying the hereby approved House in Multiple Occupation (HMO) shall be limited to no more than five (5) persons within three (3) bedrooms.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development, in accordance with Policy D3, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and the Council's HMO Licensing Guidelines. | Cycle storage for five (5) bicycle spaces shall be provided within the curtilage of the site (as per the proposed site plan), within a secure, lockable compound in accordance with all adopted standards prior to occupation of the building and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.

Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and Policy T5 of the London Plan (2021). | No cooking facilities shall be installed at any time in any of the rooms. All cooking and preparation of hot food shall take place within the communal kitchen identified on the approved plans.

Reason: To ensure that the HMO rooms are not wholly self-contained and to protect the amenity of the occupants of each of the rooms and neighbouring properties, in accordance with Policy D3, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD and Council HMO Licensing Guidelines. | Prior to occupation, the house in multiple occupation hereby approved shall contain at least one (1) complete sets of cooking facilities and these shall be retained at all times.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policy D6 of the London Plan (2021), policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013), policies 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy.
| The proposed development shall be in accordance with the approved HMO Management Plan.

Reason: In the interest of residential amenity in accordance with policy D3, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012).
